intro: Cinnagrostis recta, commonly known as goldenrods, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. These plants are native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere and are characterized by their showy, golden-yellow inflorescences. They typically grow in moist to wet habitats such as marshes, swamps, and along stream banks. Cinnagrostis recta species are often found in wetland ecosystems, where they play a vital role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity. Their flowers attract a variety of pollinators, including bees and butterflies, making them ecologically significant.
